title: Chicken & Biscuits On A Stick
directions: Cut the biscuits down to size using a small biscuit cutter and bake them in the oven until golden brown.
Season the chicken pieces with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Toss the chicken in the egg wash mixture and then dredge in a bowl mixed with the flour and cornstarch.
Fry them up until they’re golden brown.
Put the chicken and biscuits on a skewer and serve.
A few sprigs of fresh thyme
1. Cook the sausage, onion, and garlic together in the butter until the sausage is just cooked through.
2. Throw in the fresh thyme and flour. Cook out the flour for about 60 seconds while constantly stirring.
3. Add in the half and half. Be sure to stir and scrape any bits that may be on the bottom of the pan. Once the mixture comes to a boil, it will thicken.
4. Season with salt and pepper and serve.
ingredients: 2 large chicken breasts, boneless & skinless, cut into about 2 inch cubes
2 eggs, beaten with about a tablespoon of water
Small biscuit cutter (you could even use the cap of a 2 liter soda bottle)
